intro: Barleria affinis, commonly known as the pink barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The flowers attract bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological value.
